description: From Middle English liquefien, from Anglo-Norman liquefier, from Latin liquefacere.

verbs.description: liquefy (third-person singular simple present liquefies, present participle liquefying, simple past and past participle liquefied)

examples: We'll liquefy this rock by heating it in a furnace until it melts and flows out.

entries.meaning: (image manipulation, especially Adobe Photoshop, transitive) To distort and warp an image.
